creator: Jagmeet Singh
title: (No AI) As AI jitters rattle IT stocks, Infosys partners with Anthropic to build ‘enterprise-grade’ AI agents
dc:creator: Jagmeet Singh
content: Under the partnership, Infosys plans to integrate Anthropic's Claude models into its Topaz AI platform to build so-called "agentic" systems.
contentSnippet: Under the partnership, Infosys plans to integrate Anthropic's Claude models into its Topaz AI platform to build so-called "agentic" systems.

title: (No AI) Laurie Spiegel on the difference between algorithmic music and ‘AI’
author: Terrence O’Brien
content:
![Laurie Spiegel on the streets of NYC.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/04-Laurie-Spiegel-by-Irina-Prosser.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

From Bell Labs to Macs, Laurie Spiegel has pushed musical boundaries. | Image: Irina Prosser / Eventide

In 1986, electronic music pioneer Laurie Spiegel created [Music Mouse](https://youtu.be/D-mmEvGOopk), a way for those with a Mac, Atari, or Amiga computer to dabble in algorithmic music creation. [Music Mouse](https://www.eventideaudio.com/software/music-mouse/) is deceptively simple: Notes are arranged on an XY grid, and you play it by moving a mouse around. Back in 1986, the computer mouse was still a relatively novel device. While it can trace its origins back to the late '60s, it wasn't until the [Macintosh 128K](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Macintosh_128K) in 1984 that it started seeing widespread adoption.

By then Spiegel, was already an accomplished composer. Her 1980 album [_The Expanding Universe_](https://lauriespiegel.bandcamp.com/album/the-expanding-universe?search_item_id%3D1696851893%26search_item_type%3Da%26search_match_part%3D%253F%26search_page_id%3D5139357610%26search_page_no%3D0%26search_rank%3D2=) is generally considered among the [greatest ambient](https://pitchfork.com/features/lists-and-guides/9948-the-50-best-ambient-albums-of-all-time/) records of all tim …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/report/879819/laurie-spiegel-is-celebrating-40-of-music-mouse-with-a-modern-revival)

From Bell Labs to Macs, Laurie Spiegel has pushed musical boundaries. | Image: Irina Prosser / Eventide	

In 1986, electronic music pioneer Laurie Spiegel created Music Mouse, a way for those with a Mac, Atari, or Amiga computer to dabble in algorithmic music creation. Music Mouse is deceptively simple: Notes are arranged on an XY grid, and you play it by moving a mouse around. Back in 1986, the computer mouse was still a relatively novel device. While it can trace its origins back to the late '60s, it wasn't until the Macintosh 128K in 1984 that it started seeing widespread adoption.
By then Spiegel, was already an accomplished composer. Her 1980 album The Expanding Universe is generally considered among the greatest ambient records of all tim …
Read the full story at The Verge.

title: (No AI) Samsung is slopping AI ads all over its social channels
author: Jess Weatherbed
content:
![Three screenshots taken from AI-generated Samsung ads on YouTube.](https://platform.theverge.com/wp-content/uploads/sites/2/2026/02/Samsung-AI-slop-ads-.jpg?quality=90&strip=all&crop=0,0,100,100)

Even if the AI wasn’t being disclosed, its usage in these videos isn’t exactly subtle. | Image: Samsung / The Verge

After cramming AI into every inch of its smartphones, appliances, and other devices, Samsung is now increasingly slapping it across social media. Several videos posted to the company's YouTube, Instagram, and TikTok accounts in recent weeks were made or edited using generative AI tools, including its latest teaser for the upcoming Galaxy S26 series.

The "[Brighten your after hours](https://www.youtube.com/shorts/QkomSJ7P4O4)" video features two people skateboarding at night, and supposedly shows off the low-light video capabilities of the upcoming Galaxy S26 devices. Fine print appears at the bottom of the screen towards the end of the video, flagging that it was "generated with the as …

[Read the full story at The Verge.](https://www.theverge.com/tech/879864/samsung-ai-generated-edited-video-ads-slop)

title: (No AI) GPT-5.2 derives a new result in theoretical physics
content: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.
contentSnippet: A new preprint shows GPT-5.2 proposing a new formula for a gluon amplitude, later formally proved and verified by OpenAI and academic collaborators.

title: (No AI) Introducing Lockdown Mode and Elevated Risk labels in ChatGPT

creator: Emily Mullin
title: (No AI) AI Digital Twins Are Helping People Manage Diabetes and Obesity
dc:creator: Emily Mullin
content: As patients and employers look for alternatives to pricey GLP-1 drugs, Silicon Valley startup Twin Health is using AI and wearable sensors to help people make healthier choices.
contentSnippet: As patients and employers look for alternatives to pricey GLP-1 drugs, Silicon Valley startup Twin Health is using AI and wearable sensors to help people make healthier choices.

creator: Joel Khalili
title: (No AI) The Small English Town Swept Up in the Global AI Arms Race
dc:creator: Joel Khalili
content: The residents of Potters Bar are working to protect the “green belt” of farms, forests, and meadows that surround London from the endless demand for AI infrastructure.
contentSnippet: The residents of Potters Bar are working to protect the “green belt” of farms, forests, and meadows that surround London from the endless demand for AI infrastructure.
